name: natural gas, burned in gas turbine | natural gas, burned in gas turbine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27054/documentation

This dataset represents the combustion of natural gas in a gas turbine [MJ fuel input] with the specific gas supply in Canada.;This activity represents burning of natural gas (supplied at high pressure) for the purpose of supplying energy to processes in the liquefaction/evaporation, (transport) transmission, and distribution of natural gas. As described in Bussa et al. (2023, section 4.2.2), this activity is intended to replace the three different datasets related to natural gas 'burned in' (in gas turbine, for compressor station, and in gas motor for storage) from previous studies by Schori and Frischknecht (2012) and Faist Emmenegger et al. (2007).;Reference(s):;Bussa, M., N. Jungbluth, Ch. Meili (2023) Life cycle inventories for long-distance transport and distribution of natural gas. ESU-services Ltd. Schaffhausen, Switzerland. Available from: http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/

This activity starts with the input of natural gas, at high pressure.

The module includes fuel input, infrastructure (gas turbine), and emissions to air.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: A default inventory, based on generic estimates, is assumed representative for all geographies.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature. The emissions are based on generic estimates.
